required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of 2 Different Concentrations of CD1579 Gels Versus Vehicle in the Treatment of Acne Vulgaris.
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blinded, Vehicle-controlled Parallel Group Efficacy and Safety Study of 2 Different Concentrations of CD1579 Gels Versus Vehicle in the Treatment of Acne Vulgaris.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to assess the efficacy and safety of two concentrations of CD1579 (2.5% and 5%) versus vehicle in the treatment of acne vulgaris in the Japanese patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Changes From Baseline in Total Lesion Counts
primary_outcome.description: Median percent reductions from Baseline in total lesion count (ITT-LOCF)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Subjects With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events which were observed in 5% or more patients with either group are listed.
Highest severity of local tolerability scores worse than Baseline
Highest severity of local tolerability scores worse than Baseline
Highest severity of local tolerability scores worse than Baseline
Highest severity of local tolerability scores worse than Baseline
Highest severity of local tolerability scores worse than Baseline

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women at the age of 12 or older at the Screening visit.
- Those with clinical diagnosis of acne vulgaris with more than 20 noninflammatory lesions (open and closed comedones) and 12 to 100 (inclusive) inflammatory lesions (papules, pustules and nodules) on the face (forehead, both cheeks, nose and chin).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those with more than two nodular acne lesions or any cysts.
- Those with the diagnosis of any acne conglobata, any acne fulminans, any chloracne, or any drug induced acne.
- Those who have clinically significant abnormal findings or conditions on skin other than acne such as atopic dermatitis, perioral dermatitis, or rosacea that potentially interfere with study assessments according to Investigator's judgment

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
